member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Diagnostics.LogActivity.Suspend
member.summary: Suspends the current async activity. This method is typically invoked before an async method is suspended, just before the await keyword. The activity must than be resumed by a call of the method. In most cases, it is more convenient to use the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Diagnostics.Logger.OpenActivity(PostSharp.Patterns.Diagnostics.LogActivityOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Opens a custom activity with an optional description, but without parameters. The activity must be synchronous, i.e. must fully execute on the same thread and must not be interrupted by an await or yield return operator.
member.param: A description of the activity, or null to use the caller method name as the activity description.
member.returns: A representing the new activity.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Diagnostics.Logger.OpenActivity(PostSharp.Patterns.Diagnostics.LogActivityOptions,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Opens a custom activity with an array of parameters. The activity must be synchronous, i.e. must fully execute on the same thread and must not be interrupted by an await or yield return operator.
member.param: The description of the activity, including parameters (e.g. Writing {LineCount} line(s) in file {Path}.)
member.returns: A representing the new activity.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrentAccessToken.Dispose
member.summary: Indicates that the operation requiring access on an object has completed. If the method is not invoked before the method, the transaction is considered to have failed. Current threading models do not support transactions and therefore this semantic is currently unused, but it may be used in the future.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IThreadAware
member.summary: Interface implemented by objects that are aware of concurrency. Access to thread-aware objects is controlled by a concurrency controller (). Any aspect implementing a threading model (ThreadAwareObjectAttribute) introduces this interface to the target class and ensures that accesses to this class go through the controller.
